Now running ahead of 2002-03 in DC. 11.7 inches of snow on the winter is good for 22nd most on record, winter to date. #cancelthewintercancel https://t.co/dq63npeXhw
@jenconnic True on many fronts sadly

RT @jenconnic: @islivingston I guess if you want snow, you're going to see snow in the models
Like I said, though, it's really hard to kn…

@jenconnic people have been chasing it a while already.. there is typically a transition around now in Nino winters I suppose.. plus it's been quiet in the northeast overall (northeast of here at least). Ninos are known for blockbuster storms and pattern on some models matches more or less.

@jenconnic pattern is ripening over time ahead but im a little unsure about a few things.. like there may be too much cold for a while. I'd imagine there will also be a big snowstorm or two in the last 10 of Jan through mid-Feb or so. but so far it's mostly theories.
@BLynch74 @wxmvpete this is a DC winter.. https://t.co/lAOJVQbaF9
It’s relatively easy to differentiate the people who came to Internet wx over the past decade and those prior. Way more hype maps from the former.
And every year it becomes more hypey. I kinda miss the days when people weren’t allowed to post the Euro. https://t.co/cFAsb7sB0V
@mapgirl18 I wasn't paying too close attention but it is a good look at 500mb for a sys like this.. and it's not really a clipper so it has some moisture.
One thing about this winter so far is all the vorts try to make a great pass for us to cash in. Watch us boom on this little pseudo clipper Thurs. https://t.co/bkKisgZwo1

@DildineWTOP newer stuff looks pretty good without the usual tweaks.. maybe some day. or some day an iphone cam will be basically equal to a dslr. it has made me think I should just get a high powered pocket cam to carry around but seems silly to carry two (including phone).
Here's the GFS for wind chills Sunday night. 1 am Mon seems like a bad time for a long excursion outdoors. #superfront https://t.co/QseTTqaSLS

One q ahead is if cold is overpowering for a time. NHEM analogs for d11-15 continue to be colder than snowy for now.
Top 5 on 12z eps (week following departure, coldest DCA temp)...
Jan 1977 (-15, 2) Jan 2013 (-8, 15) Jan 1994 (-22, -4) Jan 1985 (-14, -4) Jan 2016 (+0.2, 16)
@serratazara not sure I'd count you in that group based on your tweeting.. usual suspects in the media and adjacent
@Nathanaj80 was thinking the cold dump may shut things down a bit but looks like waves keep coming so who knows. maybe never.

@Nathanaj80 it is very hard to do here as advertised plus I think some people are forgetting how model qpf works (6 hrs prior vs a snapshot with the temps). this season has had an odd knack of putting upper level vorts/lows in great spots.. this tries so it's worth watching.

@EricBlake12 this might go back to wondering if the GFS hurts forecasts at all as it was south until the very end. a hi rez nam/Euro blend was pretty darn good at the end.

@EricBlake12 I thought it was pretty well behaved myself. I think people were maybe a bit shy and also think people are often unwilling to forecast based on extrapolating a model trend through the end.. like everyone stopped with the bullseye just south which didn't seem likely at the end.
DC has now seen 33 snow events with 10 inches or more snowfall since the official record began in 1888-89. 10.3 inches from this weekend's storm is good for 29th largest on record overall.
